seo.title: Getting Around Washington DC | Airports, Metro, Union Station, Buses
seo.description: The clean, quick guide to Washington DC transportation. Airports, Union Station, Metro lines, and DC Circulator with practical tips for getting around.

hero.title: Getting Around Washington DC
hero.intro: Washington DC is well connected. Fly in, ride the rails, or hop on the Metro. This guide gives you the smoothest ways to move.

cards.name: Dulles International Airport (IAD)
cards.desc: Hub for international flights with access by taxi, bus, and the Silver Line Metro.

cards.name: Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport (DCA)
cards.distance: Just across the Potomac in Virginia
cards.desc: Closest airport to downtown with quick Metro access on the Blue and Yellow lines.

sections.title: Union Station
sections.subtitle: The central rail hub
sections.body: Union Station runs Amtrak for the Northeast and beyond, plus regional rail and intercity buses. It is a reliable jump point for getting around DC or heading up and down the East Coast.

sections.title: Washington Metro
sections.subtitle: Fast citywide coverage
sections.body: Six color-coded lines connect neighborhoods and top sights like the National Mall and museums.
tips: Grab a SmarTrip card or use contactless pay
Stations near the Mall can get busy during events

sections.title: Buses & DC Circulator
sections.subtitle: Low-cost links between key spots
sections.body: Metrobus covers the city and suburbs. The DC Circulator is a simple, low-fare shuttle connecting places like the National Gallery of Art, Georgetown, and Capitol Hill.
highlights: Simple flat fare on DC Circulator
Good for short hops between attractions
